bibl.title: [Letter] 1812 Apr. 26 [to] Thomas McNeal, Duck River / David Hutcheson
bibl.author: Hutcheson, David
bibl.note: The following document is a letter dated April 26, 1812, from David Hutcheson to Thomas McNeal in Duck River. Hutcheson writes of business matters and debts that are due to him.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div1.p: Dr friend Nothing has occured in my family
Dr Sir I am in grate ne many

I Recd. a Letter you sent by Capt Leatch Directing me to give him Doctor Hendersons large Note he has not yet cld for it but it is ready for him when he dos no part of it being yet paid to me I have Recd no money for you since I wrote last and I dont know if God knows when I will Money never being Scarcer since I first began to collect Cotton is now selling in Charleston at five Dollars pr. Hundred Expecting how the time would be I put what was remaining of your Debts in suit before Last cost viz a Remainder of about 24 Dols. of David Wilsons Note about of of sum: Hutchesons but no Judge attending of course we had no cost which puts the busnes back six Months about 20 Dollars of a Remainder on Doctor Hendersons Note which I expect he will soon pay 9 Dollars of Robt Andersons note I know not how to get these two I have not sued James Johnston I sued long since Recd 4 Dollars & I Doubt will get no more— Isaac Garrisons oldest Daughter is Married to George Wilson a taylor by trade I suppose you formerly know him I belive I have nothing more to add but that we are all well and that I am and will ever be in the most comprehensive sense thy friend
div1.closer: David HutchesonMr. Thos. McNealRemember me to your sister & Write to me
